comments:
After running Eclipse for some period of time, Eclipse stops responding to 
mouse input.  It is still responsive to keyboard input.  While it is possible 
to open menus, selecting menu items does nothing.  By clicking on the "X" in 
the top-right corner of the window, it is possible to shutdown Eclipse.  If 
Eclipse is shutdown while this problem is occurring, the following 
NullPointerException occurs. 
 
I200404281424.  GTK+ 2.4.0.

The exception stems from content assist being invoked by the auto-assist
listener (auto-popup typing . after some delay) that has nothing to do with the
mouse.

Do you always get the mentioned exception or was that just once?

Fixed the NPE. Moving to Platform UI for comment since the NPE most likely isn't
the cause for the reported problem.

I've seen similar weirdness in the last integration build.  Initiating a drag
killed gnome entirely - the mouse pointer was stuck with the drag image.  Moving
the mouse was possible, but no part of the UI (eclipse or otherwise) was
responsive to mouse input.  Billy suggested this was a consequence of the patch
for Bug 58575.  I've been trying to reproduce this but without success.

This problem was caused by the event re-ordering in Display.update().

Fixed > 20040406.
